result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

3:30 PM Defendant Heather A. Nelson in court.  Attorney Michelle M Erdman in court for Heather A. Nelson.  Attorney Jeffrey Kemp in court for State of Wisconsin. NMG-clerk. Reading waived, NG plea entered on all counts. CT accepts plea, preserved 15 days pre arraignment rights. Bond cont. adj. 3:33 pm
Status conference scheduled for December 19, 2022 at 10:15 am.
Status conference on December 19, 2022 at 10:15 am.

9:00 am Defendant Heather A. Nelson in court.  Attorney Michelle M Erdman in court for Heather A. Nelson.  Attorney David Stilin in court for State of Wisconsin. CH - Clerk State calls Deputy Stone - S&T. Atty Erdman objects to questioning. State - response. CT. objection is under advisement. CT. identification made. Atty Erdman - cross. CT. object overruled. State - redirect. CT. venue established, PC found, DE bound over for trial. State filing information at a later date. CT. bond cont. 9:25 am adj.
Arraignment scheduled for September 16, 2022 at 03:30 pm.
Arraignment on September 16, 2022 at 03:30 pm.

Preliminary hearing on August 24, 2022 at 09:00 am.
